Comment: I was recently driving through a rural section of the country. A town with boarded up houses and broken down trailers. Clearly impoverished and the type of place I imagine it's especially difficult to escape from, no matter how tightly you grab those bootstraps. It was so remote, I'd be surprised if they even had running water and electricity. But there, in a trailer park which I guessed to be the hub of the community, I saw a flagpole with a massive TRUMP 2024 hoisted in the middle. I wish I had taken a picture. The disconnect between these Americans living in squalor thinking they could identify with a billionaire who couldn't care less about them. It was depressing. I suspect they only hear Trump's promises and choose to believe them because they're so fantastical. Nevermind everything else.

Comment: My parents used to drive for meals on wheels in Appalachia. They would drive up these steep mountain dirt roads sometimes a mile or more into deep wilderness and there would a run down shack made out of scrap wood, pallets, blue tarp and rope. No running water, only barely power. No front door. The instructions were to just leave the food on the counter inside the front. And in the window was a Trump sign. You cannot make this stuff up.
